title: Angelina Jolie says she and Brad Pitt will "always be a family" despite divorce - Mirror Online
text:

Angelina Jolie says she and ex-husband Brad Pitt will "always be a family". 
The actress filed for divorce last year and although the pair have decided to go their separate ways, Angelina hopes the whole thing will make them a "stronger" unit. 
Speaking to BBC World News , she said: "I don’t want to say very much about that, except to say it was a very difficult time and we are a family and we will always be a family, and we will get through this time and hopefully be a stronger family for it... 
"Many, many people find themselves in this situation. My whole family, we’ve all being through a difficult time. My focus is my children, our children... and my focus is finding this way through. Read More The former couple have six children together (Photo: FameFlynet) The couple split after 11 years together, just months after their second wedding anniversary (Photo: AFP) 
"We are and forever will be a family. I am coping with finding a way through to make sure that this somehow makes us stronger and closer." 
Angelina is currently in Cambodia for the film premiere of 'First They Killed My Father', where she was was joined by her six kids - Maddox, 15, Shiloh, 10, Pax, 13, Zahara, 12, and eight-year-old twins Vivienne and Knox. Angelina visited Cambodia with her children Shiloh, Pax, Knox, Vivienne, Zahara and Maddox (Photo: PAOLO STAGNARO/NETFLIX) 
Speaking at the premiere, she said: "I cannot find words to express what it means to me that I was entrusted with telling part of the story of this country. 
"This film was not made to focus on the horrors of the past, but to celebrate the resilience, kindness and talent of the Cambodian people. Read More Angelina Jolie surrounded by her six children in Cambodia for first red carpet appearance since Brad Pitt split Angelina adopted son Maddox from Cambodia 
"Most of all, this film is my way of saying thank you to Cambodia. Without Cambodia I may never have become a mother. 
"Part of my heart is and will always be in this country. And part of this country is always with me: Maddox." Like us on Facebook
